content: g4g simple snood for greyhounds © sandra levey 2022 i use a simplified version of my own ginnie s snood1 pattern to knit and donate to gear 4 greys2 an australian online shop assisting rescue/re-homing groups such as racing 2 rehome3 all profits from sales of that pattern are donated to r2r please consider purchase of the original pattern to assist in my efforts here i have instructions for the simplified version most often seen in the facebook group sewing and knitting for greyhounds lurchers & sighthounds gear 4 greys on facebook instagram and their website and @ginnie_the_greyt on instagram i am happy for you to use this pattern to make projects on a non-commercial basis which are then donated to a rescue/re-homing group local to you 1 https //www ravelry com/patterns/library/ginnies-snood 2 https //www gear4greys org/ 3 https //www racing2rehome org/ *disclaimer this pattern was written to suit most greyhounds that i have had the privilege to meet please size one size fits most medium to lafeerlg freee gto rmeakyeh anoyu alntedrastio n slip_stitch neecees snaroy tteo ssu itf oyoru r vnaeerdisa btyi oreand in g the notes below as with anything placed around your dogs throat please be sensible and ensure the dog is comfortable wearing it yarn main colour dk/8 ply - 1 skein or allow 2 skeins if working in one colour throughout the entire project aim for around 130 metres contrast colour dk/8 ply - 1 skein **choose colours that contrast strongly for the best effect i have chosen wool for its warmth gauge 24 sts and 26 row to 10cm 4 measured across stocking stitch/stockinette needles 4 0mm circular needle in 40cm 16 length or size to achieve gauge notions one stitch marker tapestry needle for weaving in ends measuring tape skills required knit in the round knit front & back increases abbreviations k knit p purl st/sts stitch/stitches kfb knit into the front & back of a stitch - single stitch increase before beginning please read through the entire pattern before commencing taking particular note of the possible variations you might wish to try this pattern is worked in the round on a circular needle knit from the top ears down toward the shoulders my measurements are taken in metric conversions to imperial are approximate 1 g4g simple snood ©sandra levey 11 june 2022 pattern upper using mc cast on 78 sts join in the round and place a stitch marker knit one round ensuring that stitches have not twisted work in k3 p3 rounds until work measures 10cm from cast-on edge centre continue with mc or introduce the cc as you prefer if you wish to add length to this central section such as would be needed for a very tall greyhound or borzoi take note of how many additional row you require based on your row gauge ensuring you have sufficient yarn increase by 6 sts as follows k12 kfb 6 times - 84 sts work in stocking stitch/stockinette for another
